header.p: A subset of the Jmol application is available for use as an applet.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: The Jmol applet requires Java 1.1 or later. Although, the applet should work with any browser, the latest Java Plug-in is recommended.

section.title: Downloading the applet
section.p:
To use the applet, you must first download the applet distribution and extract the files. It can be downloaded from SourceForge or using one of the following links:
jmol-applet-$APPLET-VERSION$.zip
jmol-applet-$APPLET-VERSION$.tar.gz

In the jars directory are several jar files. Some of them are optional. The jmol-applet.jar contains the majority of the applet and therefore is required. The vecmath1.1-1.12.jar contains linear algebra routines and is also required. The cdk-cml.jar and gnujaxp-saxonly.jar are used for reading CML files, and are optional. You will only need to include them if you wish to read CML files.

section.title: Creating a Web page
section.p:
To use the Jmol applet in a web page, use the <APPLET> tag with parameters specifying the molecule file to load. For example, the this HTML was used to display the applet seen below.
<APPLET CODE="org.openscience.jmol.applet.JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="jmol-applet.jar,vecmath1.1-1.12.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="model" VALUE="caffeine.xyz"/> </APPLET>

The following applet displays a CML file. Note the additional jars listed in the archive parameter.
<APPLET CODE="org.openscience.jmol.applet.JmolApplet" ARCHIVE="jmol-applet.jar,vecmath1.1-1.12.jar, cdk-cml.jar,gnujaxp-saxonly.jar" WIDTH="200" HEIGHT="200"> <PARAM NAME="model" VALUE="methanol1.cml"/> </APPLET>

section.title: Applet parameters
section.p: The following parameters control the appearance and behavior of the applet:

appletParameterList.param: A file relative to the HTML page or escaped CML data (<, >, " written as <, >, ").
When reading embedded CML data, the format must be specified with a value of "cmlString".
The foreground colour for labels, etc.

The atom and bond rendering style. One of:
SHADED
QUICKDRAW
WIREFRAME
The location of the "AtomTypes" file relative to the HTML page.

Whether or not to use the wireframe mode during rotations. One of:
ON
OFF
Changes the initial zoom. "1" is the default.
Changes the size of the atoms. "1" is the default.

Specifies if bonds are drawn initially, and if they can be selected by the user. One of:
ON
OFF
NEVER

section.title: Using the applet
section.p:
The following keys and mouse actions control the applet:
S - cycles through the various drawing styles for atoms and bonds
L - cycles through the various labeling modes for the atoms
B - toggles the bonds off and on
Mouse - rotates the molecule
Shift-Mouse - Zooms in and out
Ctrl-Mouse - Translates the molecule
